definition: failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street
variant of 途[tu2]
surname Tu
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: After the first round, my team was skunked by the competition.
sentences.chinese: 第一轮后，我的小组一败涂地。

sentences.english: But after the father embezzles sentences, I arrogant collapse completely.
sentences.chinese: 可是父亲贪污被判刑后，我的骄傲就一败涂地。

sentences.english: I don’t want to risk losing a contest in violence.
sentences.chinese: 我可不想在一场暴力对决中输得一败涂地。

sentences.english: His first performance was a debacle: the audience booed him off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 一败涂地，观众发出嘘声把他轰下了台。

sentences.english: With all the cards on the table, Lando realized that he was set up to lose.
sentences.chinese: 现在所有的牌都摊开了，兰多意识到他将一败涂地。

sentences.english: Do you ver feel like breaking down?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经觉得自己一败涂地吗？

sentences.english: Losing an election does not have to mean losing our way.
sentences.chinese: 选举上一时的失败并不意味著我们从此就一败涂地了。

sentences.english: Yelling at your mom may get you in worse trouble or even grounded.
sentences.chinese: 对妈妈大喊大叫会让你深陷困境或者一败涂地。

sentences.english: This afternoon the New York Giants mopped the floor with the Washington Redskins.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午纽约巨人队把华盛顿红人队打得一败涂地。

sentences.english: I reserved foreshadowing, suffer a big.
sentences.chinese: 我预留的伏笔，一败涂地。

sentences.english: Our team got clobbered on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 我们队星期六一败涂地。

sentences.english: If I lose heart, I will be a penniless failure.
sentences.chinese: 如果连心都丢了，我将会是一败涂地。

sentences.english: Our football team was clobbered in last night's game.
sentences.chinese: 我们的足球队在昨晚的比赛中一败涂地。

definition: troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
utterly defeated
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to lose a war
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
lit. the path exhausted, the end of the road (idiom); an impasse/in a plight with no way out/things have reached a dead end
to be defeated and dispersed
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
to retreat in defeat
to be in a sorry state/to be utterly defeated
lit. people rebelling and friends deserting (idiom)/fig. to find oneself utterly isolated
